author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Jackets Struggle at ITA All-American Championships, Move to Consolation
text:
Jackets Struggle at ITA All-American Championships, Move to Consolation
Georgia Tech's Alejandra Cruz and Scarlett Nicholson faced tough competition as they opened the main draw of the ITA All-American Championships. Both players lost their matches in three sets and will now proceed to the consolation draw. The tournament is being held at Cary Tennis Park in Cary, N.C., with Nicholson ranked No. 16 and Cruz ranked No. 54 prior to the event. Despite strong efforts, including a tiebreak win from Nicholson, both fell short in their respective matches. They will compete again on Thursday in the backdraw for a chance at automatic entry into the NCAA Singles Championship.
- Scarlett Nicholson lost to No. 34 Leyla Britez Risso (Tennessee) with scores of 6-2, 6-7 (6-8), 6-1.
- Alejandra Cruz fell to No. 20 Zoe Hammond (Kentucky) with scores of 6-7 (5-7), 6-3, 6-4.
- Both Cruz and Nicholson enter the consolation draw after their losses.
- Their next matches are scheduled for 9 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. on Thursday.
As they prepare for their consolation matches, both players aim to secure a position for the NCAA Singles Championship in November, adding pressure to their upcoming performances on Thursday.
Bottom LineDespite setbacks in their opening matches, Georgia Tech's Cruz and Nicholson now look to capitalize on the consolation draw, where success could lead to a significant NCAA Championship opportunity.
Read more at Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets
